author: By Angela Ukomadu and Alexis Akwagyiram
title: Africa's biggest city Lagos locks down to defend against coronavirus

By Angela Ukomadu and Alexis Akwagyiram
LAGOS (Reuters) - Lagos, Africa's largest city of at least 20 million people, ground to a halt on Tuesday as it and the Nigerian capital Abuja entered a two-week lockdown to stop the spread of the coronavirus.

author: Sam Mednick and Cara Anna / AP
title: Africa Records More Than 1,000 COVID-19 Cases, Spanning at Least 40 Countries
description: Africa’s cases of the coronavirus rose above 1,000 on Saturday while two heads of state appeared to defy their own travel restrictions.
content:
(OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso) — Africa’s cases of the coronavirus rose above 1,000 on Saturday while two heads of state appeared to defy their own travel restrictions to attend another president’s inauguration.

author: Jerome Delay, Nqobile Ntshangase and Andrew Meldrum / AP
title: South Africa Has First Deaths From Coronavirus as Three-Week Lockdown Begins
description: A shaken South Africa on Friday announced its first two deaths from the coronavirus as the country's cases rose above 1,000.
content:
(JOHANNESBURG) — A shaken South Africa on Friday announced its first two deaths from the coronavirus as the country’s cases rose above 1,000 and a three-week lockdown began, with some police screaming at the homeless on emptying streets.
